fields.summary: Option to Receive Emails for Minor Releases
Ability to send filter result via email directlly
JIRA mail handler to check for user email address in the Reply-To header

fields.description:
Since JIRA v6.3 services that are provided by plugins are no longer shown in the services page (/secure/admin/ViewServices!default.jspa) of the administration panel.

Affected plugins are, for example, Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA, Arsenale Dataplane, custom plugins of ours, ...

The services do seem to run, they just aren't listed. Is this correct behaviour starting from v6.3? It doesn't seem desirable because it keeps administrators from changing the interval of services and is confusing since it makes it seem the services aren't installed properly.
fields.summary: JIRA v6.3.x does not list all services on the services page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41664].
  {panel}

*Issue*
If the SSL certificate of a system that JIRA connects with such as LDAP or crowd changes such that the certificate is issued to different DNS name or IP address or the issuer of the certificate is different then the following exception can occur, even though certificate is valid: "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation".

*Cause*
The fix for CVE-2014-6457, "Triple Handshake attack against TLS/SSL connections (JSSE, 8037066)", prevents peer certificates changing during renegotiation. However, if endpoint identification (see SSLParameters.getEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm) is enabled for a connection or the potentially changed certificate is for the same 'identity' as the last certificate seen then the connection is permitted. If the identity of the certificate has changed then a "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation" exception is raised.

Note: two identities are considered equal in this case if:
a) There is a subject alternative name specified in both certificates which is an IP address and the IP address in both certificates is the same.
b) There is a subject alternative name specified in both certificates which is a DNS name and the DNS name in both certificates is the same.
c) The subject and issuer fields are present in both certificates and contain identical subject and issuer values.

*Possible solution*
If you encounter a "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation" error try restarting JIRA. If the issue persists open a support issue.

*Workarounds*
* It is possible to disable the unsafe server certificate protection by applying the following JVM argument:
{code}
-Djdk.tls.allowUnsafeServerCertChange=true 
{code}
fields.summary: Support secure session resumption when changes are made to SSL certificate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41662].
  {panel}

Currently on the bulk edit screen, the fields appear to be ordered with the following logic:

(Available) System Fields, in their specific order, determined by Atlassian.
(Available) Custom Fields, in alphabetical order by name.

The problem is because this ordering is not really used anywhere else, and the possibility for fields to simply not appear (and be moved down to the bottom under a folded away section) the location for an expected field can move a lot.

If someone is regularly doing bulk operations, and the field can appear first, or 15th or not at all in the list, it makes it very difficult to find each time - even worse if you need to find multiple fields to update. This leads to admins getting questions about fields disappearing, when they haven't.

Would it be possible to re-organise this screen in a way that shows more logic to the end users, or possibly allow custom ordering of the fields?
fields.summary: Better ordering of fields on the Bulk Edit Screen
JIRA REST interface for disabling an option from drop-down custom field
Workload Report doesn't count issues without time estimates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41659].
  {panel}

When on JIRA Mobile view, there is no option to switch to Confluence or any other application.

At the moment a user has to either:
* Type the URL manually
* Switch to Desktop version and then switch application (and the browser will remember you are in Desktop version the next time you are back in JIRA)
fields.summary: On Mobile View, provide a way to switch between applications
Feedback dialog title is not ADG compliant.
Can't paste images into this feedback form.
Audit log for change to Status configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41653].
  {panel}

A missing feature of JIRA is the ability to document the usage of schema entities for the EndUser (screens and fields, workflows and so on).
In would be nice to a have a very special confluence space, namely «Jira Help», where Jira admins can document all the elements above mentioned. 
The Space would be populated automatically by all the «documentable» entities of the Jira projects. At the same time, every element of the JIRA that has been provided with an help, would be enabled to show the documentation.
It would be so possible to:
- Document screens
- Document fields (possibily on screens)
- Document states (possibly on workflows)
- Document workflows
- Document validations on workflows
and so on… with an integrated help on line in Jira
fields.summary: «Jira Help» Space

fields.description:
After Cloning an issue, the Activity event (on the Project's Summary dsahboard) incorrectly reports the source issue Assignee as the person who performed the Clone operation, rather than the actual person that performed the Clone.

This creates an integrity issue with respect to JIRA tracking and reporting User activities.
fields.summary: Project Activity Item Incorrect When Cloning an Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41651].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding custom fields to JIRA issue screens, it is not possible to dictate where these fields show up. Currently custom fields always show up in the left hand column of the 'Details' section of the issue.

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.305.0
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field or utilize an existing one
# Edit any screen within a project
# Add this custom field to the screen
# Create a new ticket
# Ensure that you have input data into this custom field
# View the new ticket

h3. Expected Results
When editing the screen, a user should have the ability to specify which column the field will be displayed in just like he/she can place fields on separate tabs

h3. Actual Results
There is actually no option to specify field location within the screen edit page
 
h3. Notes
In addition to this, it would helpful if custom sections could be created for JIRA tickets as well
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like the ability to change the location of where a custom field is displayed in an issue.

fields.description:
When reindexing etc.., rest only returns empty strings
I.E when you have the screen showing "JIRA Access Constraints" when trying to access through a browser, REST will only fail silently which is highly undesirable when running automated tasks through REST
fields.summary: REST does not return an error when JIRA is locked

fields.description:
When you go from a filter to an issue and then click on a sub-task, you are not able to use the back option on the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue and a sub-task.
# Create a filter that displays the issue.
# Click on the issue on the filter results to open the issue. Notice that the URL will have {{?filter=<filterID>}} appended to the URL.
# While on the issue, click on the sub-task to open it.
# Now try to go back to the issue by using the back button.

h3. Expected Results

You go back to the issue.

h3. Actual Results

The URL in the browser updates, but you are not taken to the previous page.

h3. Additional notes

Reproducible on IE, Firefox, Safari
Going to an issue via issue links is affected as well.
fields.summary: Back Button Doesn't Work Properly When Viewing an Issue Selected in a Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41648].
  {panel}

Today when reseting the password, we get the following message after type the username:

!reset.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if we can have a more generic message in this screen, not leading the customer to think he did everything correct.

The reason why I'm asking this is because the same message appears if you type an inexistent username. Maybe a message like "If a valid username was informed, you should receive a email (...) If the email does not arrive, please contact your JIRA administrators.".
fields.summary: Generic message when reseting password

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
- Create a Field Configuration named Bug and add *Affects Version* as a required field.
- Create a Field Configuration Scheme named Bug Scheme and associate issue type to *bug* 
- Add the Bug field configuration to the *Field Scheme* for an example project
- You should now have a project with *Affects Version* set as required for issue type bug, and this field is not required for all other fields. 
- Create an issue with a type other than bug (eg. Story)
- Add a subtask to this issue and attempt to move it to issue type Bug. You will notice the *Affects Version* field is required, however there is nothing populated in the drop down.

!example.png|thumbnail!

Expected Result:
- The dropdown should allow you to set an *Affects Version* for the task and the subtasks.


Workaround 
If you set the required fields to the desired value prior to the move, the operation will complete successfully.

I've tested and reproduced this behavior against JIRA 6.3.8 and JIRA 6.3.13
fields.summary: Required Affects version Field Not Selectable During Bulk Issue Move
Releasing a version shows the Release Date one day behind the date originally set

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When viewing a calendar in JIRA (for example from a date/time field), it the red column that is usually reserved for Saturdays and Sundays is shown on Mondays instead

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure your JIRA language to be Latvian
# In a date/time field, view the calendar :

!latvian calendar.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When language is set to Latvian, weekends in calendar are off

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41632].
  {panel}

h4. Steps
# Open fresh IE in order to circumvent potential "do not show this message" from the past.
# Click an issue collector button.
# Ignore Javascript errors (e.g. via "do not show this message again").
# Fill the form, including an attachment.
# Submit the form.

h4. Expectation
Step #3 should not be necessary. A confirmation with link to the created issue should be seen.

h4. Reality
After step #2 Javascript errors occur multiple times, stating that {{'JIRA' is undefined}} - [^Screen Shot 2015-01-14 at 17.52.13.png], hence step #3.
When the form is submitted, there is a tiny {{textarea}} with JSON inside it - [^Screen Shot 2015-01-14 at 18.08.16.png]. The issue is created, but *the attachment is not there*.
fields.summary: Issue collector errors on IE9
Support database connection using LDAP string

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41630].
  {panel}

Current behavior: 
When you make a comment on an issue in Jira, the timestamp on that comment will initially display as "in one minute".  This doesn't make any sense.

Expected behavior: 
When you make a comment on an issue, the timestamp should either show as "one minute ago", or simply display the date and time that the comment was entered.
fields.summary: Comment log shows "in one minute" rather than "one minute ago"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41629].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
[STRM-2272|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2272] might cause a timeout with a message saying "The activity source for 'JIRA' was slow to respond and isn't included." and "No activity was found" where the data should be when trying to view Activity Stream gadgets. This issue tracks the upgrade of JIRA to use a more recent version of Activity Streams (5.4.13) in which the issue was fixed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue can be replicated in environments where issues have very long histories and many records are returned.

h3. Expected Results
The Activity Stream is expected to show the stream of activities. 

h3. Actual Results
The Activity Stream shows an error reporting no activities, or the slow to respond message.

h3. Notes
For more information, please see: [STRM-2272|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2272] and [JIRA Activity Stream returns One or more activity sources were slow to respond and are not included|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Activity+Stream+returns+One+or+more+activity+sources+were+slow+to+respond+and+are+not+included].
fields.summary: Activity Stream can timeout for issues with very long histories
Provide the ability to sent notifications based on schedules
Update Running JIRA as a Service documentation
Workflow that do have dialogs do not have ellipses on their buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41624].
{panel}
h3. Current Behaviour

When accessing JIRA on a Mobile Device, a header is visible suggesting to *Switch to Mobile View*.
h3. Feature Request

When accessing JIRA on a Mobile Device, the header suggesting to *Switch to Mobile View* should be disabled because it is consuming space.
h3. Workaround

*With administrator permission*

# {code:title=Add below into the announcement banner box}
<style type="text/css">
.mobile-switch { display: none; }
</style>
{code}
# As listed in [Using JIRA on a Mobile Device|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/using-jira-on-a-mobile-device-320603334.html?_ga=2.64131244.26734136.1502634064-1865520758.1491808277]
{panel}*Can I disable JIRA mobile for my site?*
You can disable JIRA mobile for your site, so that users will only be able to access the desktop view of JIRA on their mobile device.

JIRA mobile is a implemented as a add-on in JIRA, so you can disable it by disabling the add-on. For instructions on disabling add-ons, see Managing Add-ons. Note, JIRA mobile is a System Plugin.{panel}

*Without administrator permission*
_IOS_
 # go to JIRA in the Safari browser, click the Share Icon, choose Request Desktop Site. This will reload the page without this banner bug.
 # go to JIRA in a different browser on iOS that supports agent string switching and switch the Agent string to a desktop browser.
fields.summary: Disable "Switch to Mobile View" header on mobile browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41623].
  {panel}

Instead of using the getProjectObject() used the getProjectId() to reduce the time taken for indexing.

Trace for reference:
{code}
"IssueIndexer:thread-9" #1642 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00002b47d1ad6000 nid=0xc98 runnable [0x00002b490ea71000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$AccessQueue.contains(LocalCache.java:3847)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.drainRecencyQueue(LocalCache.java:2624)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.expireEntries(LocalCache.java:2648)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.runLockedCleanup(LocalCache.java:3484)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.cleanUp(LocalCache.java:3476)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.postReadCleanup(LocalCache.java:3452)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2238)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3970)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3974)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4834)
        at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:56)
        at com.atlassian.jira.project.CachingProjectManager.getProjectObj(CachingProjectManager.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl.getProjectObject(IssueImpl.java:354)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.getRelevantConfigSchemeId(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:176)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.isRelevantForIssueContext(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:287)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.isRelevantForIssueContext(CustomFieldImpl.java:674)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.indexers.impl.AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.isRelevantForIssue(AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.java:62)
{code}
fields.summary: Reduce indexing time by explicitly requesting for project ID instead of project's objects

fields.description:
Jira standalone webapplication contains xml-apis-1.3.04.jar that contains classes found in JDK 7 and JDK 8. Duplicate classes relate to XML processing such as javax.xml.namespace.QName, org.w3c.dom.Entity, org.xml.sax.Attributes and many others.

Jar location in jira standalone package: atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\lib\xml-apis-1.3.04.jar

According to Tomcat documentation (http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/class-loader-howto.html) "Classes which are part of the JRE base classes cannot be overridden."

Duplication of classes resulted for me in java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError and java.lang.LinkageError in my plugin.
I deleted xml-apis-1.3.04.jar from my standalone jira and it fixed the problem.

Please delete xml-apis-1.3.04.jar from jira distribution.
fields.summary: Jira web application's library xml-apis-1.3.04.jar duplicates classes from JRE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41619].
  {panel}

I'm the maintainer of the Sauce Connector plugin for Jira (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/manage/plugins/net.customware.plugins.connector.saucelabs.saucelabs-connector-plugin)

The plugin is currently available to Jira OnDemand users and we've just released a new version which fixes an error that is generated when users attempt to use the plugin.

The error that is thrown is a NoSuchMethodError, and the error is related to the Customware Atlassian Adapter plugin.  As far as I can tell, version 1.4.26 of the Customware adapter plugin is now being used by Jira OnDemand, and this version includes a change to the RemoteUpdateRecord class which is incompatible with the version of the Sauce Connector plugin,

Specifically, the net.customware.plugins.connector.core.remote.bean.RemoteUpdateRecord class in previously had a no-arg constructor, but now has a constructor with arguments.

We've released version 1.6 of the Sauce Connector plugin (available from https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/artifact/96a2dfde-d2cd-4f6d-8c28-c2db603c3142/saucelabs-connector-plugin-1.6.jar) - would you be able to make this version of the plugin available to Jira OnDemand users?
fields.summary: Allow version 1.6 of Sauce Connector plugin to be available to Jira OnDemand users

fields.description:

h3. Summary

When configuring Global Filters for Activity Streams, the username textbox is a free text field. Adding more than one user separated by commas causes a SQL Exception in the logs.

2018-01-29 12:29:56,983 StreamsCompletionService::thread-3319 ERROR user 749x698817x6 1a3866b 139.149.61.99 /plugins/servlet/streams [c.a.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:Oracle
	- version:Oracle Database 11g Enterprise Edition Release 11.2.0.4.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning, Real Application Clusters, Automatic Storage Management, OLAP,
Data Mining and Real Application Testing options
	- minor version:2
	- major version:11
Driver:
	- name:Oracle JDBC driver
	- version:11.2.0.2.0
java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column index
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.find(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:296)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Although the exception is written to the logs, the Activity Stream applies the global filter correctly.
h3. Workaround

(!) *Important*: This workaround might prevent troubleshooting real problems with the Activity Stream, since *any errors will be suppressed*.

[Set the logging level|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+set+logging+level+for+a+package+in+JIRA] for the package below to {{OFF}}:
 * {{com.atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider}}
fields.summary: Adding multiple users to username field in a Global Filter for Activity Streams throws  'parameter index out of range'

fields.description:
h4. Summary
According to this ticket [JRA-2993|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2993], email notification should not be sent to Inactive Users, starting on JIRA 5.1. And according to this ticket [JRA-30152|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30152], Inactive users should not be getting email sent from JIRA (in Send Email function) starting on JIRA 6.3.4. 
However, Email sent from the *Contact Site Administrator* form is received by the Inactive users in *jira-administrator* group. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Enable JIRA Contact Site Administrator
# Take Amanda as the inactive users, she is part of *jira-administrator* group
!inactive.png|thumbnail!
# Access the Contact Site Administrator form > click Send
!siteadmin.png|thumbnail!
# Amanda (who is inactive) received the email
!inactiveemail.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional Information
# Tested in 6.3.6, 6.3.7, 6.3.9, and 6.3.11
# Not reproducible in 6.3.6
# Reproducible in 6.3.7, 6.3.9 and 6.3.11
fields.summary: Contact Site Administrator Form sends email to Inactive Users

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41605].
  {panel}

Currently, when writing comments you'd need to stop writing it, attach the file or screenshot, and then add the screenshot to the comment field.

If the comment is inside a transition, you'd need to also have the 'Attachments' field in the same screen, and when previewing the comment JIRA will show a red warning saying that there isn't such attachment.

It would be very convenient if it was possibly to attach a screenshot directly into the text (using crtl/cmd+V), similarly to the capability in the Confluence editor.

This would be specially helpful as the [Wiki Editor for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-wiki-editor] will be bundled in the future.

fields.description:
Created a custom date field called Expiry Date and set the following parameters in the Basic Search:
!date_1.jpg|thumbnail!
- It shouldn't return issues with an expiry date in the future but issues with an expiry date of yesterday. A bug has been raised for this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41602

Switching to Advanced Searching makes a lot of difference. 
!date_2.jpg|thumbnail!
- Let's say, today is 13th of January. The query means that it should return issues with Expiry date greater than or equal to 12th January. which is contradicting to what the Basic Search states "Within the last 1 day".
fields.summary: Basic and Advanced Searching with Contradicting Information

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Create a custom date field. let's say, "Expiry date" as an example. 
* Create issues with a value on Expiry Date
* Go to Issue Navigator and choose the Expiry Date, "Within the last 1 day"

Expected Result:
* For example, today is 13th January, It should return all issues with an expiry date of 12th January. as it was set 1 day before today.

Actual Result:
* It returned issues with an Expiry Date in the future,
fields.summary: Custom Date Field Returns Inaccurate Results

fields.description:
We're noticing quite a few image processing related exceptions in our blobstore analytics events, which report when provided attachment processing functions throw exceptions.

The stack trace for one:
{code}
javax.imageio.IIOException: Unsupported Image Type
at com.sun.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.readInternal(JPEGImageReader.java:977)
at com.sun.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.read(JPEGImageReader.java:948)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.StreamingImageRenderer.scaleDown(StreamingImageRenderer.java:53)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.StreamingImageRenderer.renderThumbnail(StreamingImageRenderer.java:28)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager$6.withInputStream(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:492)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager$6.withInputStream(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:488)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager$6.get(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:725)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager$6.get(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:719)
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.Functions$ToGoogleAdapter.apply(Functions.java:131)
at com.google.common.base.Functions$FunctionComposition.apply(Functions.java:205)
at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.map(Option.java:281)\n\tat com.atlassian.fugue.Options$1.apply(Options.java:113)
at com.atlassian.fugue.Options$1.apply(Options.java:111)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.plugin.analytics.EventPublishingBlobStoreService$3.apply(EventPublishingBlobStoreService.java:80)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.plugin.analytics.EventPublishingBlobStoreService$3.apply(EventPublishingBlobStoreService.java:78)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$1$2$1.get(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:126)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.Throws$1.call(Throws.java:30)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.Throws.nonFatal(Throws.java:46)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.Throws.nonFatal(Throws.java:28)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.Result.catching(Result.java:36)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.Result.catching(Result.java:52)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$1$2.apply(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:123)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$1$2.apply(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:120)
at com.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.flatMap(Either.java:485)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$1.get(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:119)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$1.get(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:103)
at com.atlassian.fugue.retry.RetrySupplier.get(RetrySupplier.java:93)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$6.get(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:293)
at io.atlassian.blobstore.client.impl.RemoteBlobStoreImpl$6.get(RemoteBlobStoreImpl.java:290)
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.Suppliers$FromGoogleAdapter.get(Suppliers.java:100)
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.Suppliers$CallableAdapter.call(Suppliers.java:119)
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.Executors$DefaultSubmitter$CallableRunner.run(Executors.java:62)
at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LimitedExecutor$Runner.run(LimitedExecutor.java:93)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}

We're also seeing these other exceptions that have the DefaultThumbnailManager in the stacktrace somewhere:
* javax.imageio.IIOException: Unsupported Image Type
* javax.imageio.IIOException: New BMP version not implemented yet.
* javax.imageio.IIOException: Failed to read a chunk of type 1933723988
* javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid icc profile: duplicate sequence numbers
* java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Numbers of source Raster bands and source color space components do not match

For more details, feel free to ping us in the BlobStore room. These are just creating noise in our analytics, and presumably not impacting the app itself. Ideally these exceptions shouldn't be thrown but passed back as a failure return type.
fields.summary: Image processing related exceptions thrown by thumbnail code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41594].
  {panel}

After renaming a project and project key on SDOG I could no longer access the project.

*Workaround*
* Create a new dummy project with the same key as the *newly renamed pkey*
* In the UI, the system may seem like it's not responding
* In the logs, we will see an error indicating duplicate project keys
* At this point, simply cancel the creation request 
* After which I could access the renamed project as expected.

Details:
Old key was 'CRAP', new key is 'REALM'.
REALM showed up in available project list, but trying to open the project gave me the "Project not found" page.
I used to be able to see and administrate the project before the change.
Background re-index did not help.
fields.summary: Project may become unavailable after changing key and/or name

Would be great if JIRA and the rest of the Atlassian Tools could support the usage of OpenJDK platform.

Thanks!
[~mr-patel] 

h5. Update 2018-07-10
* In January 2019 Oracle will stop providing public updates for Java SE 8 for commercial users as outlined in [Oracle Java SE Support Roadmap|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/eol-135779.html].
* For product releases after Java SE 8, Oracle will designate a release, every three years, as a Long-Term-Support (LTS) release. The next planned LTS release is Java SE 11 (18.9 LTS) coming out at the end of September 2018. 
* Beginning with Oracle Java SE 11, the _Oracle JDK will be available for free only for development, testing or demo purposes_.
* Starting with Java 9 Oracle has started providing _OpenJDK_ builds which can be used by those who do not want commercial support.
fields.summary: Add OpenJDK as a supported platform for Jira

fields.description:
Index may cause issue during [CSV import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer]. It happens when there is project with single issue type only and there is required custom field with Context set to that project. During manual creation is everything OK.

*Replication*
# Create new JIRA project, with exactly one issue type.
# Add new custom field. And restrict context for that issue type.
# In project Issue Field Configuration scheme set all fields to optional, except Sumary (It is mandatory to have it mandatory) and the new custom field.
# Create issue normally - it works
# Create issue by CSV import - Import fails because that field is always treated as null.

*Note:* Because there is only single issue type, import wizard do not offer Issue Type for mapping. My theory is that importer checks context before it actually applies issue type - automatically.

*Workaround:* Set context into project instead of Issue type.
fields.summary: CSV Import for restricted custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41578].
  {panel}

h5.symptoms
When users try to access JIRA Agile boards or Service Desk, pages reload infinitely. It's also the case for some Connect add-ons.

h5.cause
Due to a temporary bug we just encountered, JIRA is parsing usernames incorrectly when *there's a space in the username*. That's why Connect add-ons using username as a parameter are affected too. A bug fix in in progress.

h5. WORKAROUND
The bug fix is in progress. If access is urgent for your team you can work around the issue by renaming the user to remove all spaces from their username. Only users with _site-admins_ access can rename users.

(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:00hrs GMT+0: We are currently still working on a fix at the back end. The fix will be released to all affected Cloud instances soonest possible. Please *watch* this issue to get latest information on the fix.
(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:30hrs GMT+0: This issue is confirmed to affect also JIRA Server 6.3.13 and will be fixed in 6.3.14
(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:50hrs GMT+0: We are currently testing a fix and will start deployment shortly if successful.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile and Service Desk pages constantly refresh for users with space in a username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41576].
  {panel}

*Situation*: 
- universal workflow for all Scrum projects
- need to notify developer chat room on HipChat whenever there's a transition on a task

*Problem*: with universal workflow that is used across different projects, it is not possible to define project-specific HipChat room for a project. On the other hand, universal HipChat room is of no use since on many projects and all developers in a single room, it devalues.

*Possible solution*: have an environment variable with chat room name that is picked from the project settings, not the Workflow that may be generic and used across different projects.
fields.summary: Decouple HipChat notifications from Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41572].
  {panel}

Our company uses multiple Atlassian products, like Jira, Confluence, Bamboo and Crucible. For source code control we are using PlasticSCM since it's the best state of the art tool for that. We have experiences with git, subversion, cvs and mercuical but all of them are not a patch on PlasticSCM. Unfortunately non of the Atlassian products supports PlasticSCM directly.

Currently we are using the PlasticSCM plugins provides by Codice. But most of the time there are not as nice integrated as the repositories which are directly supported by Atlassian. 

We think it is necessary for Atlassian to support PlasticSCM natively, since it's the best SCM system on the market, at least in our opinion. The native support would add value to all Atlassian products.

Especially Fisheye would benefit of a PlasticSCM support, since there isn't a plugin available yet. If you would integrate PlasticSCM support to Fisheye, we would immediatly buy a License for our Company. And I am sure others will do the same!
fields.summary: Adding Plastic SCM repository support

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Disable the *common* module from the *jira-help-tips* plugin via {{Administration -> Manage Plugins -> System Plugins}}
# Search any words from Quick Search.
# From the screen, you can't expand any drop down menu such as Dashboards, Projects, Issues or Agile.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41559].
  {panel}

For the moment this bug(s) was only reported OnDemand and we do have some reasons to believe that is also related to the server load.

Expected behaviour: return a JSON response.

Problems:
* 200 means success and should never have an empty body. Empty body success responses are supposed to use code 204 -- http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html
* An empty body is an invalid JSON response, this not being allowed.
* If it is an authentication failure, this MUST return a 401 or 403 code.
* This is not a real authentication failure because we are 100% sure that the credentials are right (using basic_auth).
* If the server is not able to respond due to other causes it MUST reply with a 503 code and optionally with a Retry-After header that tell the client when to retry the request.

As stated above this bug uncovers several serious HTTP standard deviations, probably caused by several broken pieces of code.

It may be useful not remark this response header and the fact that, so far, all reports were happening while using basic_auth

     'x-seraph-loginreason': 'OUT, AUTHENTICATED_FAILED'

Atlassian support suggested, as a temporary workaround, to use alternative authentication options. Still our tests proved that other auth ways are even more prone to fail. Also BASIC_AUTH is documented in several places as the recommended authentication to use with REST, that being one of the reasons we call it *REST*.
fields.summary: Some REST calls return 200 with no body and AUTHENTICATED_FAILED

fields.description:
Disclaimer: I'm not certain whether the problem lies in JIRA or actually in the german localization bundle.

*The Bug:*
Since the update from JIRA 6.0.3 to JIRA 6.3 one of our clients is encountering a problem with the date picker on all occurrences inserting the wrong abbreviation for the month March leading to the error message:
"You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "8/Jan/15""

Using the german loca for JIRA, the correctly formatted date for i.e. 1st of March (German: "März") would be: "1/Mär/15"
Entering this manually is accepted by JIRA.
However, using the JavaScript Date-Picker, it enters "1/Mrz/15" in the respective field, which is denied by JIRA with the error message mentioned above.

*Solution:*
The JavaScript of the Date-Picker should be corrected in order to use the appreviation "Mär" for March.
Alternatively it could also make sense to change the abbreviation to "Mrz" in JIRA - the date-picker would then already use the correct value.

If you require more info, feel free to let me know.
fields.summary: Date-Picker inserts wrong abbreviation for March in german Locale
Inline issue update ignores possible operation errors

Click on Bulk edit operation 
Click on the checkbox to select to edit all the issues

actual: The general checkbox gets checked but each individual issue checkbox is not. See screenshot

fields.description:
h2. Steps to replicate:

Open JIRA in IE 11. Have to have at least 11 JIRA projects, so that there is a scrollbar in the Project dropdown. 
- Click on "Create" button on the top;
- Click on a right expansion arrow to open a dropdown Project listbox;
- BUG: Clicking on "UP" or "DOWN" arrows just collapses the dropdown box.
- BUG: An attempt to drag the scroll bar collapses the dropdown box.

h2. Workaround:
When using the mouse's scroll wheel, it works.
fields.summary: Project dropdown when creating issue not working using IE 11
